newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela 6-month TEM yields fall to 14.35 pct.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela 6-month TEM yields fall to 14.35 pct.

text.p: Yields on Venezuelan benchmark six-month TEM bills fell 213 basis points to 14.35 pct in Wednesday's Central Bank auction.

The bank said it sold 50 billion bolivars of 179-day monetary stabilization, or TEM, bills with a 16.47 percent coupon for a price of 100.98 percent. At last week's auction the six-month TEM bill yielded 16.48 percent.

The bank also sold 20 billion bolivars worth of 268-day notes with a 16.81 percent coupon at an average price of 100.01 percent, and 20 billion of 358-day bills with a 17.15 percent coupon at an average price of 99.50 percent.
Yields for these notes fell 201 basis points to 16.80 percent for the 268-day notes and 185 basis points to 17.75 percent for the 358-day notes.
The weekly TEM bill auctions are the Central Bank's principal tool of monetary policy, used to restrict liquidity and establish a benchmark for wider interest rates.
